.definition: to suggest something for discussion
.example: Various reasons are put forward.

.definition: to hang (curtains or drapes) on rods or other fasteners
.example: The dealer put up three of his most valuable paintings for auction

.definition: to begin a journey
.example: We set off early the next morning.

.definition: skilled at doing or dealing with a specified thing
.example: You need to find something you’re good at.

.definition: immediately
.example: The best time is right now.

.definition: to show the method used
.example: We progress by means of trial.

.definition: to move in a particular direction; advance in life by one's own efforts
.example: The mouse made its way across the field.

.definition: to cause something to happen or exist
.example: She believes quotas give rise to "tokenism".

.definition: if that is, if that is so
.example: If so, you may want to consider Greece.

.definition: used to introduce a comment or question that is not directly related to what you have been talking about
.example: By the way, what day is the wedding?

.definition: occasionally but not regularly
.example: He does come round from time to time.

.definition: already dealing with it
.example: It was well in hand by then.

.definition: in a few words
.example: I did a lot of things in the office and at home. In short, I had a busy day.

.definition: to be a sensible thing to do
.example: Doesn’t it make sense to do it that way?

.definition: in the next building
.example: The criminal had been living next door all this time

.definition: in contrast or instead of
.example: Life in the countryside is quiet as opposed to life in the city.

.definition: to end a relationship with a romantic partner
.example: After dating her boyfriend Dan for four year, Erica finally decided to break up with him.

.definition: have a harmonious or friendly relationship
.example: I always get on with my mother

.definition: dealt with, forced to handle something
.example: Faced with defeat, he changed tactics.

.definition: to do what has just been mentioned.
.example: Failure to do so could mean a fine or a jail sentence

.definition: a method or way of doing something
.example: He hasn’t the means to get there.

.definition: continually or often from a past time until now
.example: And they haven’t been the same ever since.

.definition: almost exactly; nearly.
.example: Am I finished? Just about.

.definition: something was done in a grand or big manner.
.example: They were thinking on a large scale.

.definition: used to show that the way you describe something is only true to a limited degree
.example: The news came as a bit of a shock.

.definition: but when you think about the matter more or in another way:
.example: I agree she types accurately, but then again, she's very slow.

.definition: used to emphasize that something is the case to an extreme or unwelcome extent.
.example: Why is this all too familiar?

.definition: very much, far, or a great amount or degree
.example: We’re still a long way from achieving our sales targets.

.definition: to become worthwhile or successful
.example: When will this play amount to something? It has yet to get one positive review!

.definition: for a long period of time
.example: He did attend university, but not for long.

.definition: to be operated by someone
.example: The operation is run by two college students.

.definition: used to indicate that something continues to happen for a further period of time.
.example: I’ll have to think some more before deciding.

.definition: while someone or something isn't here; without someone or something.
.example: In the absence of the cook, I'll prepare dinner.

.definition: many different kinds of something
.example: There are all sorts of machines being developed to upgrade security.

.definition: to start or continue doing something, especially work
.example: I suppose I could get on with the ironing while I'm waiting.

.definition: not very useful or effective
.example: It's no good trying to change his beliefs.

.definition: One more; an additional
.example: That’s yet another day gone by with nothing done.

.definition: the most important part of achieving something or explaining a situation
.example: Revision is the key to good writing.

.definition: used for politely telling someone something that might make them sad, disappointed, or angry
.example: It hasn't arrived, I'm afraid.

.definition: that which is just a wordy way of saying what and could be shortened
.example: That which has been obvious for some time now is finally being officially acknowledged,

.definition: because or as a result of
.example: In view of the late hour, we'll have to put off that discussion until our next meeting.

.definition: thoroughly; including every detail; with all particulars
.example: I can explain in detail.

.definition: displayed by or shown in the results or outcome of something.
.example: I hope all our hard work is reflected in good sales of the new product.

.definition: used to say that a particular person, object, etc., does not really exist
.example: I've told you before, sweetie, there's no such thing as ghosts!

.definition: only
.example: I have nothing but respect for her.

.definition: being threatened with something
.example: They quit in the face of the media scrutiny.

.definition: used to express purpose or result.
.example: It can be developed such that it does not interfere.

.definition: used to show the reason why someone does something
.example: I took the job out of necessity because we had no money left.

.definition: to arrive at the moment when something happens
.example: It got to the point I couldn’t breathe.

.definition: to have an opportunity to do something
.example: I never get to see her now that she’s moved to California.
